document.docAuthor: Nagata, Renato Mitsuo, Júnior, Miodeli Nogueira & Haddad, Maria Angélica
document.masterDocTitle: Faunistic survey of Hydromedusae (Cnidaria, Medusozoa) from the coast of Paraná State, Southern Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Faunistic survey of Hydromedusae (Cnidaria, Medusozoa) from the coast of Paraná State, Southern Brazil

.

Description. Umbrella higher than wide, 0.75–1.5 mm in diameter, in the specimens analyzed. Thick mesoglea, about ¼ of the total height. Cylindrical and short manubrium, cross-shaped in cross-section, pinkish to orange-colored. Basal trunk of oral tentacles long, divided two or three times. Tentacular bulbs small, hemispherical, each with two thick tentacles without ocelli.

caption.paragraph: TABLE 1. Summary of sampling effort between November 1997 and September 2006 to provide an inventory of hydromedusae from shallow open waters of Paraná coast, southem Brazil. For complementary information see sampling source.

Systematic remarks.
Bougainvillia
is a well-defined genus and the medusae are easily recognized; however, species are difficult to identify. 32 species in the genus are valid, with 28 medusae species (
Schuchert 2013
;
Nogueira et al . 2013
); 8 were cited in Brazil , 7 in the medusa stage (Migotto et al. 2002 ).
B. frondosa
is completely distinct from other species of the genus because of the absence of ocelli and only two long, thick marginal tentacles per bulb (
Bouillon 1999
, see
Table 1
in
Nogueira et al. 2013
).

Biological data. Unknown hydroid (
Vannucci & Rees, 1961
). No information is available on the biology of the species. In Brazil it is considered rare (
Vannucci 1957
; Navas-Pereira 1981 ).
